column4: I'm trying to reinstall linux-restricted-modules. But the package manager warns that the package can't be authenticated. What can I do to ensure it's from correct repository?
sudo apt-get update (they're just out of date)
You are right!
reinstall the packages that you overwrote, that's about it
Thanks! Currently I found a mistakenly deleted /lib/modules/2.6.22-14-generic/kernel/drivers/char/drm/fglrx.ko, but I can't find where it is from
that's in linux-restricted-modules
I reinstalled linux-restricted-modules-generic, but it's still not there
still looking
Thanks!
it's wierd I don't see that
But do you have ATI card?
yes
So you don't have it in that directory?
Could you find flgrx.ko in /lib/modules to see where it is?
the ati drivers drop it into /lib/modules/$(uname -r)/misc
Strange. I don't even have that directory. Did you install it from a package?
I find it in /lib/modules/2.6.22-14-generic/volatile/fglrx.ko
Now I found one in /lib/modules/2.6.22-14-generic/volatile/fglrx.ko. Hmmm... So I guess it will be copied to that directory after restart
Oh, can you find /lib/modules/2.6.22-14-generic/kernel/drivers/char/drm/fglrx.ko ?
no, the one we found is the only one I have in /usr/lib/modules/2.22..generic
I'll restart my X and see. See you later!
and that's where I expected it with the ubuntu driver (memory finally kicked in)
I'm back. It seems to work
Can you use compiz with this driver?
